viennaptm.dataclasses.annotatedstructure.AnnotatedStructure

class viennaptm.dataclasses.annotatedstructure.AnnotatedStructure(id)

Bases: Structure

Annotates structure of the biopython Structure class. Log administration as well as adding of new modifications. PDB’s can be loaded from database or a file and annotated structures can be saved in a PDB file.

__init__(id)

Initialize the class.

add_to_modification_log(residue_number: int, chain_identifier: str, original_abbreviation: str, target_abbreviation: str)

Adds modification of atoms to modification_log.

Parameters:

  • residue_number (int) – A residue number indicates the position of an amino acid in a protein’s polypeptide chain, starting from (1) at the N-terminus and ending at the C-terminus. For example, "His 18" means the 18th amino acid in the chain is Histidine.

  • chain_identifier (str) – Peptide or protein chain ID for instances of chains - commonly 1 capital letter.

. :param original_abbreviation: The original abbreviation for a canonical amino acid refers to a standardized abbreviation for a standard, representative amino acid in a database like UniProt eg: ASP for Aspartic acid or GLU for Glutamic acid. :type original_abbreviation: str . :param target_abbreviation: A target abbreviation for a modified amino acid. :type target_abbreviation: str

delete_log_entry(residue_number: int, chain_identifier: str)

Deletes a log entry according to residue_number and chain_identifier.

Parameters:

residue_number – A residue number indicates the position of an amino acid in a protein’s

polypeptide chain, starting from (1) at the N-terminus and ending at the C-terminus. For example, "His 18" means the 18th amino acid in the chain is Histidine. :type residue_number: int . :param chain_identifier: Petite or protein chain ID for instances of chains - commonly 1 capital letter. :type chain_identifier: str

classmethod from_pdb(path: str | Path)

Loads a PDB structure from given path.

Parameters:

path (str or Path object) – Path to a local PDB file.

… :raises TypeError: Raises error if given path is not a string or Path object. … :return: Returns a biopython PDB structure. :rtype: AnnotatedStructure

classmethod from_pdb_db(identifier: str)

Loads structure from ‘PDB database <https://www.rcsb.org/>’.

Parameters:

identifier (str) – Identifier string of length four.

… :raises AttributeError: Raises an error when the parameter identifier string has not a length of four. :raises FileExistsError: Raises an error when file cannot be accessed from given path. … :return: Returns a biopython PDB structure. :rtype: AnnotatedStructure

modification_log

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

print_log()

Removes the index from the modification log and then prints the log. Even long (max. columns 1000) and wide (width 1000) data frames are printable.

to_pdb(path: str) → None

Saves a biopython PDB structure to a given path.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to save the PDB file.
